title: Fix rounding discrepancy in bilinear interpolation (40991 vs 41120)
description: Debug shows Go's ApproxBiLinear produces 41120 for pixel (1,0) when scaling 4x4 to 2x2, but Crystal implementation produces 40991. Need to examine exact ApproxBiLinear algorithm in golang.org/x/image/draw/approx.go to match exactly.

title: Implement color inversion support
Implement exact ApproxBiLinear scaling algorithm in Crystal
description: Current scaling algorithm uses bilinear interpolation with premultiplied 16-bit values and truncation rounding. However, Go's ApproxBiLinear uses different algorithm for downscaling vs upscaling. Need to examine Go source code (golang.org/x/image/draw/approx.go) and implement exact algorithm to match SHA256 hash b3b74eb4... for charm-wish.png. Key findings: 1) Go uses 16-bit premultiplied values from RGBA() 2) ApproxBiLinear uses bilinear interpolation when upscaling, bilinear blend of 4 nearest neighbors when downscaling 3) Output length difference (26676 vs 25648 bytes) suggests extra characters in Crystal output.
